gsellek wrote:
> 
> This behavior just started happening.  It happens on multiple boxes 
> with various seed sets.  As far as I can tell it is random.  
> Heritrix crashes hard, the process dies, and that's all she wrote. 
> Nothing in the runtime-errors log for that job. 
> 
> Should I be putting this stuff into the sourceforge 'bugs' section?

We'll take the report for our records and the potential information
value to other Heritrix uses, but for such a JVM crash (addressing error),
there must be a responsible JVM bug -- we make no native callouts that
could trigger a SIGSEGV.

So I would be sure to also report this to Sun, and check the Sun
forums to see if others are having the same problem.

Did you recently move to "Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.5.0_01-b08 mixed mode)"
by any chance?

You might also want to try leaving off the -server VM option; as it
changes the JVM behavior it could step around whatever bug is causing
the crash.

- Gordon @ IA

> Greg
